page.title: 09Commerce in N.E.Mynd Area
page.content: The limited needs of a sparsely pop- ulated rural area have dictated the growth of trade and industry.The majority of commercial ventures are centred around Leebotwood,the largest of the three villages in this section. This is due mainly to the A49 trunk road,once the old turnpike road,which roughly divides the village into two. A little way outside Leebotwood on the A49,there is a 'Little Chef' Rest- aurant,which offers the passing motor- ist a 'Fast food' service.Next to this there is a garage with a well-stocked shop.The shop sells various goods from car accessories to watches,clocks and household sundries.The garage also has second-hand cars and caravans and the owner now has a small garden centre adjacent to the garage.
